Origins: On 17 September 2014, the Daily Currant published an article positing that rapper Kanye West had scored 106 points in a charity basketball game against a team of children in wheelchairs:
Description: By the end of the day links and excerpts referencing this article were being circulated via social media, with many of those who encountered such reports mistaking them for genuine news items. However, the original article was just a humorous spoof of current events from the Daily Currant , a site whose " About " page notes that they deal strictly in satire: The Daily Currant is an English language online satirical newspaper that covers global politics, business, technology, entertainment, science, health and media. Q. Are your news stories real? A. No. Our stories are purely fictional. However they are meant to address real-world issues through satire and often refer and link to real events happening in the world.
Example: [Collected via e-mail, September 2014] This sounds false to me, but am not sure. It's making the rounds on Facebook. Kanye Scores 106 Points Against Wheelchair Basketball Team Have you heard of this before?
Claim: Kanye West scored 106 points in a charity basketball game against a team of children in wheelchairs.
